name: Holiday Inn Anaheim-Resort Area

reviews.text: Much in line with other reviewers, I think this is a good hotel - ideal for a few nights when you're either stopping in LA briefly or for a long weekend.
reviews.title: Good Value Accomodation

reviews.text: It's in a good location and has clean, large rooms, FREE car parking and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Not fancy, but just fine...

reviews.text: Considering you're normally in Anaheim for a full-on week of theme parks and shopping, what more could you ask for in a hotel?
reviews.title: not bad for the money
maid service lacking
reviews.text: This hotel is not fancy, however, we found our room to be very clean and the staff to be friendly and helpful.

Family of 5 stayed at the Holiday Inn Resort for 8 days, arrived there at 10:00 am and were allowed to check in even though check in is at 3:00pm, room had 2 doubles which fit all of us,teenager,child and toddler. Bathroom was very spacious the new renovations are done excellently,the staff was extremely helpful re: shopping, taxi's, pizza delivery,other attractions such as beaches. The restarant was inviting, the breakfast is a buffet with a rather large selection, the staff was very nice and polite and attentive considering my children were full of adreneline and on the go all the time and it had some of the best pricing on menu items that we have seen.I am sad that I didnt get to spend any time in the lit pool but the hot tub was great and the children loved the pool, we only made it to that area at night and it was great that both items had lights for the night time. I would highly recommend this place and have even told my parents about it.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: After staying at several Holiday Inns around Disneyland, I have finally found one I will use exclusively. The hotel is new and nicely kept. We stayed in a two room suite which I would highly recommend for families. The Bedroom had a queen bed with the bathroom. The livingroom had a sofa pullout for the kids with a mini-fridge and coffee maker. No microwave though. Each room had its own large TV. The bathroom was large enough to be its own room! The hotel also had free wireless internet access. The restaurant was marginal as was the service there. I have yet to find a restaurant attached to a Holiday Inn that was very good, so no disappointment there. Really no major complaints on this stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel.

reviews.text: -asked for the manager twice and was told by desk staff that "in a meeting"
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price
Good hotel for the money
reviews.text: -dining room very unorganized. food was very good though. had to almost always ask for cutlery to eat the meals

Me and my girlfriend visited this hotel June 18-24 2005 and it was perfect! We had a room with a king size bed and the room was very large and so was the bathroom. There was more than enough space. The staff was very friendly and it only took us about 5 minutes to get checked in. The maid service was excelent no matter what time we left the room for the day. The room was very clean and very new. I read all of the reviews of this hotel before going to it and the people that give it bad reviews must never be satisfied with anything. There is no highway noise at all (the people who complain about that must have very very sensitive ears) and the air conditioners are not that loud. I never heard anybody else through the walls either. This place was great expecially for the $72 a night I paid. There is plenty of parking. I had a rental car so I did not take the shuttle to disney but I saw the shuttle there every time I went to the parking lot so it comes very regularly. Disney is only about 1 mile away, and there are plenty of other things to do. We went to Hungtington Beach which is only about a 20 min. drive and we also went to other LA area attractions. The hotel is great cuz its right by I-5. The only things that were less than perfect are the fact that the pool is shared by the Holidy Inn and the hotel next door so it gets kind of crowded, and the restaurant is not all that great. This place is awesome though, there were a lot of families and the kids were having a blasts and the parents looked happy too. Its a perfect location to stay no matter what you are doing in the LA area because it is pretty central.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel
Nice hotel
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort Area June 11 - June 16, 2005. The website says the pool is heated. I don't think so! The water was freezing.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: Reviewers talked about the loud air-conditioner. I didn't notice it was loud since I would fall instantly asleep in the wonderfully comfortable bed. The pillows were also very firm and nice. The sheets were so white and clean.

I know what the other reviewer was saying about mold in the shower. There was line of mold that stayed inside the shower all week. I waited it out to see if housekeeping was ever going to clean it. The lighting in the bathroom was very adequate.
reviews.title: Great Stay
great hotel
reviews.text: The Anaheim Resort Transit to Disneyland was extremely slow. The trams were supposed to run every 10 minutes, but the three times we used the trams to go to Disneyland, we had to wait at least 30 minutes and by then the trams were full. Once they sent a white bus and we had no idea it was the ride we were supposed to catch to the park.

reviews.title: Disappointed with stay
reviews.text: We usually stay at the Hampton Inn Suites or Fairfield but made a quick and poor decision to stay at a hotel that we usually don't stay at. The staff was not very helpful. I asked whether we could take in any outside food into Disneyland, and the associate said only a water bottle. In fact, you may take a small lunch in, sandwich, chips, apple a drink (such as a Capri Sun, ie) in the park. They even have a designated picnic area you can have your lunch at. When you have a large family going to Disney, lunch can cost a small fortune. I was told also there was free breakfast for the kids, with a paying adult. (pancakes were $8.00) The hotel was run down, and the rooms were small. The only thing that the kids enjoyed was the free use of the Game Cube.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from July 9th till the 17th, and had a wonderful time. Our room was more than comfortable, we had requested that our room be in a quieter part of the hotel. Our window faced Disneyland, so the days that we did something else, we were able to watch the fireworks from our hotel room. We found the food in the restaurant was good, kids 12 and under eat free, there could of been more choices on the kids menu. The shuttle service to and from the hotel was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful, our room was always made up and clean. It was our first time in Anaheim, and had the best time, we found the best place to eat, it was a couple of blocks from Disneyland called Mimi's, we went there for supper one night with our 11 year old daughter, and it cost us about the same as it did for lunch the day before. My husband and I each had a beer, and pasta, my daughter had chicken fingers and pop, the portions were big, and the food was great! Anyways, we had a great time, highly recommend staying at this hotel.

reviews.title: Great hotel for the price!
reviews.text: We have just spent a week at this hotel and thought it was excellent, far better than the three star rating it currently has.

description: The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort is located in the heart of Anaheim, just minutes from Disneyland, is a full service hotel with 264 guestrooms, including upgraded executive king rooms. The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort also offers free wireless high-speed Internet throughout the hotel, including the Pacifica Ballroom, ideal for meetings and social functions. The Holiday Inn Anaheim Resort sells Disneyland Tickets in the Disneyland Resort. Located just 1 mile from the Anaheim Convention Center. Other entertainment venues within one mile include: Anaheim Stadium/Honda Center, the Home of the Anaheim Angels, Downtown Disney and Disney's California Adventure. The perfect hotel for a Disneyland vacation. Enjoy breakfast and dinner in our American Brasserie Restaurant and Bar, featuring pool and watch sporting events. Pool side drinks and dining from the Cabana Bar (seasonal), are available. Located just 4 blocks from the hotel is the Block & Garden Walk, offering movie theaters, several restaurants and shopping options. The newest Holiday Inn in Anaheim, built in 2001. A full service hotel with friendly amenities of a resort!
